intro: Sitanion rigidum var. californicum, commonly known as the California rigid sitanion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
